p: Diabetes Mellitus (DM) defines by The World Health Organization (WHO) as a degenerative disease that occurs when insulin is not produced enough by the pancreas to support the metabolism process in the human body [ 1]. This hyperglycemia condition is a disorder of body metabolism which is characterized by a high fasting blood sugar. Indonesia seems to have the fastest-growing burden of diabetes and the numbers will continue to grow in years forward. In epidemiology, it is estimated that in 2030 the prevalence of Diabetes Mellitus (DM) in Indonesia reaches 21.3 million people. Lousy dietary habits, lack of sleep and stress increase the risk of diabetes. Obesity is also becoming the leading cause of type 2 diabetes [ 2, 3] .
